news_header: Hurricane Milton poses a significant risk to residential properties in the Tampa Bay and Sarasota areas, with potential reconstruction costs reaching up to $174 billion depending on the storm's strength at landfall.
news_text: New data from CoreLogic reveals that approximately 500,000 residential properties in the greater Tampa Bay and Sarasota metro areas are at risk of storm surge flooding due to Hurricane Milton, with an estimated reconstruction cost value (RCV) of $123 billion if it makes landfall as a Category 3 storm. The number of homes at risk could range from 225,000 (RCV of $55 billion) if the storm weakens to Category 1, to 700,000 (RCV of $174 billion) if it strengthens to Category 4. The storm's intensity and landfall location will significantly impact the extent of damage, with potential additional costs of $50 billion for commercial properties not included in these estimates.
